get.description: Returns the list of the buyer accounts (the accounts that consume your API). Filters by state are available. The results can be paginated.

get.description: Find an account by the username or email of its users (username takes precendence over email).

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: username of the user of the account
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: email of the user of the account
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: id of the user of the account
parameters.name: user_id

get.description: Returns a buyer account.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Updates a buyer account by id. You can modify all the fields on the object account, including custom fields defined in the fields definition section of your admin portal.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.
parameters.name: additional_fields

delete.description: Deletes a buyer account. Deleting an account removes all users, applications, service subscriptions to the account.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Changes the account plan of the buyer account.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: id of the target account plan
parameters.name: plan_id

put.description: Approves the account (changes the state to live). Accounts need to be approved explictly via the API after creation. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Rejects the account (changes the state to rejected). An account can be rejected after creation, the workflow of the account creation can have a validation process that ends up in approving or rejecting the account submission. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Resets the state of the account to pending. So that it can be again approved or rejected.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Updates the JSON spec of the ActiveDoc by id. To create, delete and update description and state of Active Docs you must use the Admin Portal. This request only allows to update the JSON spec (body) service, useful when the JSON spec is generated programmatically (for instance using source2swagger). Once you have the JSON spec you can updload to be live straight away, for instance: 'curl -v -X PUT -F "body= YOUR_JSON_SPEC_FILE" https://YOUR-API_PORTAL.3scale.net/admin/api/active_docs/ID.xml?provider_key=YOUR_PROVIDER_KEY'

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: JSON Spec of the ActiveDocs (based on the spec of Swagger).
parameters.name: body

parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: Description of the application to be created.

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.
parameters.name: additional_fields

get.description: Returns the application by id.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Updates an application. All fields of the application object can be updated except the id and the app_id (in case of authentication mode oauth or app_id/app_key).

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Accepts an application (changes the state to live). Once the state is live the application can be used on API requests.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Suspends an application (changes the state to suspended). Suspending an application will stop the application to be authorized on API requests.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

put.description: Resume a suspended application. Once a suspended application is resumed it will be authorized on API requests.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

get.description: Returns the list of users of an account. The list can be filtered by the state or the role of the users.

parameters.name: provider_key

post.description: Creates a new user of the account (account_id). Do not forget to activate it otherwise he will not be able to sign-in, after creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended on the Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove the object's fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. put.description: Associates credit card tokens and billing address to an account. This operation is only required if you use your own credit card capture method. Those tokens are the ones required by Authorize.net, ogone, braintree, payment express, merchant e solutions

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: The token returned by the payment gateway. Client_id if you're using braintree (In that case, the first credit card will be used)
parameters.name: credit_card_token

parameters.description: Authorize.net payment profile token. Unused for other payment gateways
parameters.name: credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profile_token

parameters.description: Year of expiration of credit card. 2digit number
parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_year

parameters.description: Month of expiration of credit card. 2digit number
parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_month

parameters.description: Name of the person/company to bill
parameters.name: billing_address_name

parameters.description: Address associated to the credit card
parameters.name: billing_address_address

parameters.description: 4 last numbers of the credit card
parameters.name: credit_card_partial_number

post.description: This request allows to reproduce a sign-up from a buyer in a single API call. It will create an Account, an admin User for the account and optionally one Application with its keys. If the plan_id are not passed the default plans will be used instead. You can add additional custome parameters that you define in Fields Definition on your Admin Portal.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: Organization Name of the buyer account.
parameters.name: org_name

parameters.description: Username of the admin user (on the new buyer account).
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: id of the account plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).
parameters.name: account_plan_id

parameters.description: id of the service plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).
parameters.name: service_plan_id

parameters.description: id of the application plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).
parameters.name: application_plan_id

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.
parameters.name: additional_fields

The user object can be extended on the Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove the object's fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

put.description: Changes the state of the user of the provider account to suspended, remove the user's ability to sign-in. You can also do this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml setting up the state parameter.

parameters.name: provider_key

get.description: Lists of webhooks that could not be delivered to your end-point after 5 trials. A webhook is considered delivered if your end-point responds with a 200, otherwise it retries 5 times with a 60 seconds gap.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

delete.description: Deletes failed deliveries records. It is advisible to delete the records passing the time of the last webhook failure that was received instead of deleting them all. Between the GET and the DELETE other webhooks failures might have arrived.

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).
parameters.name: provider_key

parameters.description: Only failed webhook deliveries whose time is less or equal than the passed time are destroyed (if used).
parameters.name: time
